arnus regard much prejudice would thereby befall like manner inhabitant terano argue affirming river nar cut smaller stream overflowings thereof would surround fruitful ground italy neither reate city umbria silent refused stop passage lake uelinus called lago de terni said river nar businesse therefore finding opposition let alone nerva trajan attempted plin l epist likewise trench prevent fatal farther hae vero galliae c part france reason fenns unpassable province menapii caesar could never posse dion cassius testifieth speaketh caesar thus marched force morini bordering menapii thought terrified warlike atchievements easie conquered though subdued none howbeit dwelling town cottage within fenny place compassed thick wood hidden whatsoever estimation annoyance wearied roman received plurali voce latinitatem deflexa e therefore whole tract ardenburg dixmuth beyond many watrie fenny place country called ulaendren thence flanders plural number word declined latine much could adde hath made one rich populous country part world affirm baldwin first wedded n cosm gr lib p iudith daughter emperour charles bald also king france gift said king territory flanders whereof made earl baldwin besides building castle bruges place strength much clearing wood exsiccation marsh making country habitable fruitfull undoubtedly true induced believe learned uredius beforementioned saith que marcha wu actas faciant ad defensionem patriae omnes sine ulla excusatione veniant e year dccclxiiii year following baldwin bestowed labour fortifying castle town bruges moat bulwark norman virtue edict pistensian synod held year dccclxii dccclxiii recorded statute charls bald published sirmondus viz able march enemy according antient custome nation imployed making new city bridge passage fen without excuse come raise bank city limit country defence thereof story drayning part country lying betwixt dam ardenburg thereby making habitable memorable much honour active work shall next place exhibit hist netherlands p year mclxix floris earl holland demanding isle walchren zeeland philip earl flanders warr betwixt upon quarrel came accord viz count philip enjoy heir ever land waes one best quarter flanders earl holland formerly held floris restored said isle walchren consideration whereof send count philip thousand men expert making ditch stop breach made neer unto dam sluse whereby countrey drowned round every high sea fleming could mean fill neither wood matter sunk gulf without bottom whereby processe time bruges jurisdiction danger lost inundation become sea speedily repaired wheerupon count floris sent best workman could find countryes come place found great hole neer unto dam entrance thereof sea dog six dayes together nothing cry howl terribly knowing might signifie resolved cast dog hole whereupon madheaded hollander getting bottome dike took dog tail cast midst gulf earth turf finding bottom filled little little many workman came repairing work lodgd cabin made place seem pretty town count philip gave others would inhabit much land could recover dam ardenburg successor ever diver immunity freedomes reason whereof many planted tract time made good town reason dog cast hole named hontsdam say dogssluce dam flemish signifying sluce hondt dog therefore day said town called dam carryeth dog arm viz year christ mclxxx bank dam sluse called lamminsuliet raised madeannales f andr pet meie um mean sea drowned tract excluded descend holland zeland cap vi holland country consisting threefold earth viz sandy sea clay river moorish place accounted sa h bertius p ber ius de agg u c cap without good reason gift ocean river rhene mose egypt river nile testimony herodotus consonant whereunto expression oflib mi lan cap petr nannius quod si penitus liceat origines nostras inquirere omnino mihi persuadeo hollandiam munus boreae ac rheni esse c e lawful enquire original wholly perswade self holland gift northwind river rhene beginning high place ordinary tide usually flow whereby increase sand northwind fiercely agitating wave stirrd first grew shore afterwards raised sandy heap dayly see made destroyed addeth water rhene stop kept bank setled mud brought stream shore long frequent inundation produced pasture cannot imagined saith bertius p b tiu de aggeribus c face country alwayes discerned soon arose former condition unto fertile pleasant state behold present much time extraordinary labour excessive study vast expences great diligence necessary thereto nature therefore first inviting inhabitant bordering neer unto make bank sand defence northwind necessity also spurring master ingenious powerful time accustomed endeavour became second nature unusuall see boy girl come seaside recreate put stocking shooes taking sand singer make wall therewith ocean within thus encompassing despise force wave batavians warlike hardy people germany first obser ing aswell natural richnesse soyl surge ocean silt sand mud raised time height usual tide great industry making large strong bank thus gain sea make habitable credit diver munst cosm bertius ut supra historian also dane norman invasion thereof continue preserve found gotten nay find id saxon author call aggerum exstruendorum peritos skilful men making bank exercise industry kind town saxhenheym giving also testimony thereof unlikely franc whose native seat part netherlands contributed much work kind forasmuch ti app rent ibid raiser bank upon loyre france restrain inundation river drowning plain lye adjacent thereto much honour therefore due memory industrious people first set upon great profitable work cannot easily express invenire primum praecipuum que est c saith rerum invent epist ibid lu ovico odaxio polydore virg e first invention chief principal thing ame whereof exciteth many love every one possible would accounted author art without art evident could living whereunto may added consideration difficulty make much regardable quid enim la dis saith ib mentioned author assecutus esset caesar si facile fuisset britannis bellum inferre aut hannibal quantum gloriae sibi comparasset si pervias alpes dum italiam adiret citra ut dicitur pulverem sudorem que ac non magna suorum caede fecisset e renown caesar got warre britans easie businesse glory hannibal obtained passed alpes dust sweat without great slaughter souldiers silent due praise posterity whose industry hath happily gained ancestor part kept maintained besides dayly improvement thereof singular dexterity diligence much frequently increased gained end defensive wall may better preserved constitu e peculiar magistrate whose charge office look call p bertius ut supra diickgraven inner outer bank may upon occasion repaired made good case breach weakning bank strength height preserve country certain drowning high tide evident sayl port flat country full sea field within bank wherein cattle depasturing corn growing lye levell ocean many small astonishment thus shewed country holland first gained made habitable make observation advantage farther acquired late year active ingenious people great beneficial improvement number inhabitant much increasing urgent necessity enforcd make use utmost skill accomplishing somewhat might considerable case drayning sundry lake whereof sixteen considerable performed within space last fifty year tenement aforesaid overflowed drowned default bishop bondman repairing maintaining bank c aforesaid upon land said even circumcision lord xviith year said king reign hapned mighty floud proceeding tempestuousnesse sea overflowed bank aswell men land land bishop bondman drowned said ground floud afterwards retreat sea made certain groundbreach upon land said bishop could repaired labour one tenant every man land overflowed ought chardged equally proportion towards repair thereof according custome marsh farther said landholder would joyn together repairing maintaining said groundbreach common said bishop bondman would ready proportion assist contribute thereto adam de fyncham king attorney said said wall c broken torn default repair said bishop tenant upon ground beforespecified pevensey marsh betwixt birle bechief perform thing therein according custome marsh marsh romeneye law custome realm whereupon ex ver cod m penis wil le neve clar regem armorum said prior iohn pelham william makenade went unto westham parish pevensey upon friday next feast gregory consent lord town bayliff xii jurats otherwise called skawers common said marsh ordained following statute due governance marsh salvation thereof time come first certain law said marsh ordained used time ordinance pevensey marsh lord land within diver peril hurt intolerable dayly grew therefore eschewing thereof increasing common profit ordained fully agreed principal court yearly held said marsh within xv dayes feast michael archangel whereat one bayliff xij skawers also collector expenditors scott assessment chosen lord town said marsh attorney safeguard thereof bayliff oversee defect xij skawers make order decree according law custome romney marsh also every man lawful quantitie holding common pasture fishing within bound said marsh shall contribute equal portion reparation maintenance bank gutter sewer bridge necessary thing within said marsh consideration xij skawers reparation said bank watergangs gutter sewer done often needeth cost whereof made raised form viz every man hath land subject danger neer far said peril said land may saved owner profit bank watergangs gutts sewer beforementioned shall contributory land tenement according proportion tenure man holding land tenement form af resaid shall spared part rich poor state dignity condition soever within liberty without case man negligent paying portion certain day ordained skawers repairing said bank gutts watergangs men shall distrained good cattell wheresoever found within liberty without within precinct said mark wat rcourse called wythyrune obstructed aforesaid said abbot tenant wythies answered said nusance amended time said presentment long ready prove presentment suffered tree monketan hang river tone mannour brustwyk residing bond brustwyk one part land said margerie ryhill said land side drayned time mind sewer pretence certain mandate said king privy seal obtained sute said tenant threatning oppresse said margerie alleging course thereof newly diverted antient chanel mandate directed unto simon de grimesby said king steward requiring reduce old course diver trench made upon bank thereof ground said margerie ryhill extended several place current water ever till time number armed people part insomuch land meadow said margerie lay neer sewer totally overflowed tide humbre aswell said margerie danger lose whole profit said land meadow burgess held said town hedon king certain yearly ferm better paying thereof used receive much commodity boat vessel wont carryed town water said sewer making trench dryed king therefore remedy thereof gave commission ibid iohn de stonore iohn de molyns robert parnyng hugh de berwyk view rectifie amisse therein e raphe de bulmere iohn de sutton supporting bank sewer inhabitant frismerk finding burthensome e petition pat e p dorso king counsel parliament exhibited complained land often overflowed tide humbre constant great chardge safeguard could pay tax imposition done lesse able maintain said bank preservation town formerly therefore humbly besought taking premiss consideration would command fifteen granted parliament commonalty realm two year ensuing also assessment future might rat according value good catalls town vvhereupon king compassionating condition assigned pat e p dorso michael de wathe iohn de constable hasham robert de sprotle clerk iohn sturmy commissioner enquire thereof vvho accordingly certified claus e p said land often overflowed beforespecified river humbre also third part thereof totally destroyed consumed tide said inhabitant often inestimable cost safeguard town must still king therefore deeming consonant right unduly chardged tenth fifteen assessment land wasted destroyed directed precept claus e p assessor collector tenth fifteen granted said commonalty realm parliament beforespecified requiring farther information touching value movable town assesse accordingly supersede collection thereof according tax old fifteen virtue precept said inhabitant frismerk assessed claus e p xxvi viij per annum said two year king sent mandate claus e p baron exchequer requiring fifteen like future granted rated greater summ like claus e p claus e mandate also directed collector vvools estrithing county proportionable abatement inhabitant said town frismerk upon consideration e thomas metham william playce henry greystoke constituted pat e p commissioner set certain mete boundmarks king marsh fishing within part holdernesse presence advice honest trusty person country said king others might full knowledge severals marsh fishing year iohn sutton holdernesse thomas de seton de skipwith iohn de wilton appointed ibid dorso view bank c upon coast humbre betwixt town hesele ravensere also upon many labourer think necessary work upon competent wage respect great necessity hastening thereof thus traced successive commission improvement marsh isle banking drayning untill st tue cap h vvhich statute prescribing form issued time throughout whole realm wherein direction power given imployed therein make ordain necessary convenable statute ordinance salvation conservation seabanks marsh part adjoyning thereto according law customes romeney marsh likewise hear determine singular complaint shall come touching businesse according law customes realm customes said rom ney marsh appointed also upon great urgent necessity take put said work reparation many ditchmakers labourer upon competent wage might sufficient perform service necessary conceive give farther instance kind shall therefore descend great lesse commendable work undertaken shortly beginning late king charles reign drayning surrounded marsh isle adjacent fenny ground lying yorkeshire viz hatfield chase dikesmersh vvherin may omit observe ex v rsi deposi ionibus n lingu brevium de term pasch ca oli penis remem scace overflowings fresh water whole level reason beforespecified river idel bicker dyke turne done ayre obstructed diver place much silt impediment chiefly contracted dayly tide declared winter even summer time boat laden plaister passed part thereof called hatfield cha e place called hollen brigge near hatfield woodhouse water upon drowned ground three foot deep fisher house called steeres lodge standing ground thrown raised three four foot level often drowned neither haxey carr lesse overwhelmed large boat laden xx quarter corn usually passing river idel trent bank men rowing also lesser boat look swan part betwixt lammas michaelmasse like sort starr carr axholme carr insomuch lesse sixty thousand acre land thus overflowed said fresh water said king therefore seized island diver land waste ground belonging also chase called hatfield chase dike mersh together lordship wroote finningley county yorke lying upon flat royal princely care publick good regaining great proportion surrounded land best yielded little profit common wealth contrariwise nourished beggar idle person chase red deer good part fen much annoyed opprest residue resolving advice counsel partly easing chardge increase revenue partly improvement reducing great quantity drowned boggy ground made good meadow arable pasture general good great seal england contract cornelius vermuden city london esquire article bearing date twenty fourth day may second year reign substance whereof followeth first said cornelius chardge drain lay dry beginning work within three month said king agreed person interest common therein finish possible expedition said cornelius consideration thereof heir ever one full third part said surrounded ground hold said king heir successor mannour east geenwiche free common socage said cornelius pay satisfie owner land lying within level surrounded summs mony said land thought worth four commissioner whereof two named lord treasurer england time two said cornelius work finished better preservation thereof corporation made make act ordinance end occasion require consisting person said cornelius heir nominate within three year finished six commissioner appointed viz three lord treasurer england time three cornelius heir c view estimate future yearly chardge might amount unto perpetual maintaining whereupon said cornelius convey assure inheritance land value might thought sufficient support chardge whereas diver claim common pasture sundry said ground agreed king issue proceed therein according law custome realm cap xxxii observation touching whole great levell done marsh situate within province lindsey county continning still course southeast ward come next great levell extendeth self halton toynton lincolnshire good part six county viz lincolne norfolk suffolk cambridge huntendon northampton length lesse lx mile bredth peterborough northamptonshire brandon suffolk neer fourty mile excepting isle ely place kind also holland lincolnshire marshland norfolk long ago great industry gained sea shall clearly shew space many age untill late year vast deep fen affording little benefit realm fish fowl overmuch harbour rude almost barbarous sort lazy beggerly people begin manifest mean drayning improvment thereof hath accomplished proper conceive shew first noble exploit returned beyond sea forthwith sent ex regist de peterborough penis pierpont arm f desiring would repair thither power joyn defence native country redeeming liberty particular importuned behalf thurstane abbot place monk whose said island wholly whose behalf fortified king would make delay said king brought forein monk france obtrude upon abbot purposed like church throughout england request willingly condescended forthwith began journey towards accordingly whereof earl warren notice whose brother long said hereward killed laid ambush outside fen belonging isle kept guard water near land hoping take cunningly without slaughter men hereward aware thereof also guard encountred part souldiers pursued came aid taking discovering said earl set ambush likewise morrow hoherhed hastned thither ship placing armed souldiers near bank river went three horsmen fou archer well armed unto mouth thereof earl men also come side seeing sent party nearer enquiring whether belongd hereward finding endeavoured perswade forsake prevailing returned earl told hereward side water whereupon said earl animated souldiers swim presently revenge brother death told possible saying coming thither purposely thus delude whereupon earl sighing said side water oh devilish fellow master would certainly torment death word hereward replyed happen fortunate meet alone fit place would wish feeble hand like well company said stooping little bent bow letting f ye arrow hit earl breast coat mail would suffer enter neverthelesse came force struck horse servant took dead arm mean hereward went away came company isle day received great honour abbot monk also noble person viz edwine earl leicester morkere brother earl warwick eminent men country much oppressed said conquerour fled thither whereof king hearing much inraged thereat resolved get isle assault end caused rendezvous whole army alrehede neer place military rampire yet seen fen four furlong bredth brought store wood stone fagot kind multitude tree great piece timber fastned together underneath cowhide end might better passe stript skin beast filled wind like bladder done many pressed get greedy gold silver whereof supposed store isle went formost drowned bridge midst became swallowed depth fenn hindmost throwing away weapon made shift mud escape nevertheless multitude perished adventure whose body long found putrified harnesse draggd bottome water one onely man whose name beda getting isle king therefore beholding lamentable disaster much grieving thereat departed thence left without hope conquer placing guard soldier prevent within wasting country mean time said beda taken brought chief person isle asked boldly adventured told king promise whosoever first enter notable exploit danger defended let ask would man therein obtain heard commended valour kept certain day using great respect therefore experience civility observed secure place reason fortification made also number valour souldiers therein professed often heard reputed person expert warr others found true faithfully promised upon liberty go back king camp would relate much accordingly joyful see safe returned even king one eminent souldiers unto related strength isle adventure earl beforementioned two noble men viz orgar thirchitell surnamed childe extolled hereward beyond comparing famous knight seen france whole roman empire constantinople story earl warren took small offence enduring hear commendation slain brother hath observed suggested king relator bribed make partial report king going making enquiry particular observation farther account monk place earing subject soreiner regard king designed bring france chief monastery church england entertain person defence thereupon fortified said isle affirming much willing live labour hand reduced servitude isle burthened force quoth ex e cl elie bible bodl matter siege husbandman neglecting plow hunter sport neither doth fowler cease imployment concluding securely fended souldiery nay shall tell saith know saw isle extraordinary fruitfull sort grasse place england hath fertile turf moreover compassed huge water fenns strong wall aboundeth domestique cattell multitude wild beast viz hart goat hare wood neer fen also ermine polecat weesels like vermine taken trap engins winter time fish foul breed shall say floudgates upon skirt water vast company eel take net also mighty pike pickerells perch roche sometimes greater royal fish bird likewise innumerable also goose bittern seafowl watercrows heron duck abundance especially winter season moult feather whereof seen three hundred taken one time adding ex r gist de peterborough ut supra every day whilst stayed fashion sitting dinner supper common hall knight monk upper table abbot said earl also hereward turkill beforespecified likewise head knight monk hung target lance upon wall midst room upon form lay coat mail helmet arm occasion monk always aswell souldiers might ready go fight fo nd expert men weapon moreover magnified plenty thing said thought much better safe king come peaceable term adventure assail orce miscarry attempt speech thus ended stept one souldiers king imployed keep fort made reche order siege isle newly returned thence heard relation beforementioned beda said think vain report believed assure yesterday self saw party enemy make sally isle whereof seven armed monk except two behaved every point like souldiers fired town burwell much mischief otherwise men saw ten issued fort purpose take return fewer number skirmish slew men except one stout souldier whose name richard nephew osbert shireeve one wenothus single encounter wherein neither prevailing though fought good men went part whereof famous hereward taking notice within view would suffer one meddle saying two three set upon one man would suffer ser base thing men followed ship killed one mariner dart taking another prisoner told u name viz hereward general wenothus thurstane youngman afterwards sirnamed provost boter edmunds bury siward leuric ac r stoutness sirnamed hardy notwithstanding monk skilfull men arm often gave testimony valour presence said hereward king hearing would speak evil word deeming unworthy thing give bad language valiant men forbear commend courage souldiers considered make peace regard isle strongly fortified knew prevent coming thereof return vvhereupon calling together noble counsellor told thought alleging march army dane soon necessity go normandy would safe leave enemy behind midst land back noble present privy council diswaded urging dealt thus favourably imbroiled kingdome long time others would afraid like king anger replyed able conquer considering place naturally defensible vvhereupon one ivotael le bois moved indignation told long known certain old witch would art soon destroy whole strength place defence drive coward island sooner said stood became earnest suters king would make delay encourage well reward whomsoever could art skill vanquish enemy king therefore yielding perswasions caused old woman privately sent might talkt brought army together placing part isle making fortification every side thereof appointing strict guard prevent issuing forth within lest know hand use mean hinder done understood within put little disturbance mind likewise fear knowing king learnt new way warring therefore consulting best done concluded send fit person make discovery enemy hand finding man fit task valiant hereward resolved undergo either scout travailer alter habit though length set forward taking mare called swallow always lean ill shapen pace exceeding swift nimble action went changed clothes cut hair beard clad potter whose pot took feigning potter took way king court brandon suffolk got thither hapned lodged house widow old witch entertained brought privily destruction isle heard discourse latine art used subduing thereof deeming plain countrey fellow ignorant discoursed dead time night discerning woman house old sorceress go doores secretly followed saw went certain spring side garden ran towards east hearing discourse understood designed murther prevent purpose got away early morning pot wandring king court every side cryed potter use pot pot good pot pitcher good earthen ware whereupon called king kitchen might buy pot came one constable town looking upon said never saw man favour face stature like hereward poor man might like rich country man souldier insomuch diver came desiring see man like much famed person thereupon brought king hall amongst knight souldi r might behold saw said man greater limb could valour courage hereward said others asked knew ever seen wicked fellow scil hereward answered wish amongst u greatest enemy took cow four sheep good world except pot mare livelyhood self two sonns time king dinner making ready hereward retired kitchin dinner servant cook groom kitchin gave wine beer might make drunk laugh scoffing diversly purpose shave crown pull hair beard hoodwink intent might break pot set refusing thus abused one struck requited presently blow knockt insomuch rest took tongs thing beat discerning forthwith snatcht fire shovel laying stoutly killd one wounded diver whereupon made known house apprehended put ward soon king gone hunt one keeper came brought naked sword one hand pair fetter threatned put upon hereward nimble wrested sword hold slew hedge ditch hasted king outer court found mare though pursued got safe away somersham wood hid till moon shone midnight came isle whilst thus wood chanced meet person whose horse tired demanding told one king servant pursued man killed one kitchin boy another custody apprehended fact desired love god generosity sake would discover whether saw fellow described replyed thou requirest tell thee love god generosity know therefore man thou maist infallibly assured thou hast spoken take thy sword thee testimony leave thy lance reported king present admired hereward excellent souldier king therefore according former purpose prepared diver warlike instrument brought whole army aelreheth audrey causing great store wood stone diver sort fagot like material carryed thither summoned fisherman part boat meet cotingelade might transport thither whatsoever brought raise large hill heap side alreheth whereupon fight amongst fisherman came hereward also boat using shew diligence day sun setting set fire brought killed drowned diver made escape away end might known coloured head beard red neglecting way disguise might mischief adversary whereof king hearing commanded ever could taken brought alive without hurt warning loss king caused strict guard watch day night every place within seaven day raised four five mount earth materialls placed certain warlike engine intending morrow force assault isle might better succeed therein set old witch mentioned upon highest place midst well guarded might exercise wicked art got made long speech isle making signes shews vanquisht allways end spell turned bare buttock towards isle howbeit beginning third spell isle set fire reedes growing fen thereabouts help wind spread self le two furlong making horrible noise crackling amongst willow like vegetable affright assaylants hasted away fast could troubled smoak could tell way betake insomuch many drowned defendant advantage wind smoak getting isle shouring intreaty prayer monk wishing rather regard safety also telling king army wyccheford within distance one furlong desiring would secure flight case mind make peace yielded perswasions often accompanied military adventure faithfull thereupon presently betook ship guard isle certain large spacious meer called wide far welle seventh year holding isle king sailed thither regard free passage resolving stay employed souldiers towards saham plunder pillage country sent scout bring back lest taken scout finding little island called stuntney thought enemy therefore two viz scarfulte broher got amongst reedes sword shaved others crown expecting thereby find favour taken length discovering side went away together soon got master long said meer country people king souldiers beset forced flee killd de trekyngham roger de coppeldyk robert de malberthorp constituted ex regist croyl nd pene h oldfeild arm f king justice sewer part sat boston upon tuesday next feast exaltation holy cross make enquiry oath good lawful men person county lincolne used repair maintain bank ditch gutter sewer within fen kesteven holand place thereabouts also floudgates fresh water used run part kesteven said fen hindred said water turned right due course also sort whereupon sir autre knight iohn de holand several person quality sworn ex regist croyl nd pene h oldfeild arm f upon oath present town danington ought used repair causey holand little bridge ditch part said town donington new ditch said ditch unto chapel saviour prior saviour perform like repair time great defect bridge ditch also said town donyngton ought used repair sewer scathegrafte swyneman dam swane lade bredth xvi foot depth water running river byker sea hindred sewer ought open first day march feast martin winter likewise said feast martin first day march except great inundation sea happen said sewer would sufficient province holand would drowned case inundation might lawful said town donyngton stop sewer presently upon fall water open said sewer obstructed default said town donyngton ought scoured said juros farther said town byker ought repair clense said chanel bondstake quadring bredth xxiiii foot town quadring commoner belonging thereto ought scoure repair said chanel unto gosbirkirk bredth town gosberkirk ought like thence sea intent fresh water might hindered said chanels sewer said stream byker obstructed bondstake sea default town donyngton quadring commoner gosberkyrk ought clensed said moreover chanel byker dam ought open throughout whole year would expedient town byker particular commodity thereof benefit whole countrey make certain clow two dores four foot bredth clow always open excepting time mighty flood sea also said gutter sewer quadryng obstructed town quadring commoner thereof ought bredth xvi foot depth current water might hindred also ought clensed repaired said town commoner sewer gosberkyrk called risgate ee sluse betwixt fen sewer ought lye open year scathegrafte swanelade used stopped abbot peterborough town gosberkyrk town gosberkyrk commoner ought clense repair amend said sewer gutter sluse place antiently wont viz midst fen belonging abby said likewise sewer beche ought repaired clensed town gosberkyrk hynsebek surfl te fen unto surflete thence sea obstructed default town one richard de hodell raised bank course said sewer passage water hindred farther said sewer brigefleet obstructed town hekyngton ought clensed repaired town unto river swynesheved chanel sufficient carry water kyme mouth ee stopt philip de kyme great damage country sewer called encluse neer boston ought run time year stopped every winter men boston west end bridge also ought three foot bredth ought repaired maintained vvest end said bridge inhabitant boston likewise presented sewer called hamondebek south side boston also obstructed inhabitant town west part said bridge inhabitant skyrbek ought repaired clensed maintained said inhabitant boston skyrbek consideration whereof said men boston living west end said bridge ought common marsh eight hundred said sewer ought run time year said moreover men eight hundred ought clense chanel swynesheved blalberdeboche unto north part swinesheved town said town swynesheved ought scour chanel thence unto stream byker town iwardeby onsthorpe ought repair maintain south side water runneth happeltrenesse kyme decay neglect prior haverholme ought repair great part thereof refused farther said philip de kyme ought upon ground repair certain part side wathe mouthe fail thereof default said prior philip whole marsh kesteven holand overflowen drowned destruction country said philip divert course water great prejudice country especially prior kyme likewise said prior haverholme ought find certain boat bothe neer wathe mouthe carry footfolk aswell night day whensoever one pas way neglect great damage people occasion pas way said said water publick passage king liege people kesteven river wythum said moreover chanel called old hee marsh holand marsh hekyngton kyme ought repaired clensed men eight hundred holand east part henry de beaumont lord hekyngton commoner town west part philip de kyme blalberdebothe water kyme obstructed philip de kyme also said town great hale commoner ought repair maintain certain causey gerwyk pyngelhyrne foot horseman beforespecified town hekyngton gerwyk ought clense repair chanel gerwyk unto water swynesheved say unto blalberbothe clensed midst said chanel next park southpart parson hale ought repair likewise said burton brigg king high way one half thereof ought repaired maintained town burton together causey north part thereof half town helpryngham causey southside thereof foot horse men might safely pas fro way season year decay farther said care dyke certain stream called south ee extended byker fen also ought clensed repaired town little hale commoner thereof one part town helpryngham byker gobhenbothe part said hachelade common sewer ought run season sewer scathegrafte obstructed prior spalding ought entrance water marsh bredth one foot depth much within town le six foot broad till came sea ought repaired town pynsebek sea also said baston ee ought repaired clensed town baston thurleby obthorpe wywelesthorpe catebryg estcote raising bank higher clensing part estcote town pynsebek town surflete thence sea said town surflete narwe hee whereby course water hindred town brunne estcote ought taken trench drawing water said chanel ought stopped occasion require bank river brunne ought enlarged levebrigg brunne unto tollon made two foot higher time xij foot thickness likewise said town brunne ought clense narwe hee brunne godram crofte need farther said town baston langtoft ought repair bank catebrigg estcote two foot height xij foot thickness southside town pincebec ought make bank estcot godramcote side thence house richard nye serflet said town pyncebec like side thence sea town surflet side also likewise said chanel hirnyngbrigge pyncbek sea narrow watercourse ought xxiiii foot bredth least repaired enlarged hirnyngbrigge house richard nye town pyncebek thence sea town surflet every bridge river brunne resolved forasmuch paid might therefore lawfully proceed make decree perfect drayning thereof thereby adjudge order aswell majesty lord soil adventurer others interessed therein proportion land might therein case whether majestie would become undertaker work dispose said adventurer respect great disbursments therein whereof could receive little fruit state said fen stood wholly submit majesty wisdome pleasure desiring might speedily signified unto end might proceed accordingly humbly offered advice lordship might left power adventurer others undertake said drayning majestie perform way beforespecified bridge crouland vvhereunto belonged likewise several fishing aswell water invironing said isle pool fen within precinct thereof together marsh wood alderlound situate vvestwards falleth weland passing said river weland beginning kenulphston near stream southlake kenulph first abbot monastery fixed crosse stone limit betwixt crouland deping thence tending northward near aspath unto werwarlake harinholt mengarlake lurtlake bound holand kestevene thence oggot apinholt otherwise called wodelade uuodelade falleth uueland vvhich ample possession though yielded much profit regard great quantity thema lay part water yet denyed upon invasion pagan dane time beorred king mercia hapned chiefest refuge life monk abby secured mean spacious fenns reed thicket whereof hid ib f b avoid cruelty barbarous people whilst rest covent murthered abby burnt vvhich monk preserved woful masacre returning contented themselvs habitation ruines left would afford better untill time king edred turketill chancellour taking heart suffering procured king rebuild singular devotion god affection place giving ib f six goodly mannours thereto causing shorn monk became afterwards abbot whereupon munificence good king bounty said turketill thus restored former splendor good mean unattempted might conduce bettering improving land thereto belonging advantage may seem endeavor abbot egelric time king edward elder king edgar plowed large proportion corn could done without help drayning presume saith ingulphus ib f b fecit etiam annis sicciatis culturam suis paludibus c dry year tilled fen four place four corner three four year increase hundred fold seed soever sowed amongst fen tedwarthar fruitfull monastery much enricht plentifull crop whole country thereabouts supplyed therewith multitude poor people resorting thither respect crouland became large town ingulphus abbot norman conquerers time saith ib f b day tenant residing crouland upon land man delighting inhabit longer necessitated insomuch time warr betook hither security great number rich poor neighbouring country afterwards returned back particular home none continuing domestique family wife child let ferm great proportion marsh meadow belonging abby certain annual rent service w malmes lib f n without boat accesse thereto path farther gate monastery notwithstanding land possession abby great bounty several king others given thereto diver ample privilege immunity fearful curse pronouncd pious donours violate grant neverthelesse appears ab tam b l cot effigie b f inhabitant holand bordering northside crouland drayned marsh converted good fertile arable land whereof town proper portion wanting pasturage cattel took advantage false rumour spread king henry second death xxxv last year reign beyond sea bearing little strength wealth thought might oppresse poor monk crouland without controul whereupon gerard de bamvill fulke doiri thomas de multon elder conan son helyas much displeased said monk crouland respect associating richard de flet walter many others came nicholas prior spalding moved leader augment number chief men ellow wapentake excepted conspiring sometimes meeting prior spaldings barn uuestone sometimes church holbeche therefore abbot crouland according custome kept marsh every year used rogation week end hay might better growth caused proclamation made upon bridge spalding men holand others keep cattel coming thereinto refused drove many formerly done whereupon abbot servant impounding men holand grew angry set day viz feast nereus achilleius came said marsh crouland armed battail number three thousand whereof abbot notice forthwith accompanied family met bank called asendic boundary crouland fen earnestly intreated peace feared purpose destroy abby end come together answered scornfully passing midst fen shared among according situation town done pitched tent made hut every side abby wherein placed guard armed men keep part thereof likewise diggd turf cut great part wood king justice end dispatchd messenger geffrey fitz pier dwelling clive northamptonshire hearing great outrage sent six knight northampton better informed thereof knight coming first east side abby found tent sutton men tenant geffrey de canvill sort weapon said master command likewise rest answer tent spalding men last abbot sensible high oppression got privately made haste could london crouland spalding pinchbec langtoft baston inh presentment ex regist croyland pene io old eild arm f exhibited justice itinerant lincolne juror wapentake ellowe setting forth two course water common river croyland one nearer remote nearer current right chanell sufficient depth wherein go barge boat might well passe fro abbot croyland planting willow thereon obstructed straitghned said course stream boat barge could passe formerly afterwards adjudged said juror likewise justice itinerant county passed way view current said water much proper commodious place went juror presented default provided might continue wide deep might straight bending old one therefore concluded ordered continue ran e commission pat e dorso issued unto n de stapelton w de brumpton e de bekingham enquire oath honest lawfull men county whether abbot croyland prior spalding ought repair certain bridge gutter bank ditch part concerning difference betwixt pat e p dorsoin e petition exhibited king council parliament setting forth many peril loss befallen several men reason ill way betwixt crouland spalding also greater mischief like happen therby unlesse repairing way remedy speedily used danger loss might well avoided case new causey made betwixt said town crouland place called brother house said abbot upon proper ground making repair whereof said abbot successor take certain custome person travelling way said king therefore much affecting safeguard ease people respect desiring certified whether said abbot would willing undertake making repair causey sort directed precept requiring answer thereto whereupon abbot letter signified king distance betwixt great bridge within town crouland said place called brotherhouse within space danger passage lesse three mile fenny soil upon one side river weland reason lownesse ground moorish earth would difficult matter make causey fit durable passenger could made otherwise upon brink river much water winter time covered ground ell half depth tempestuous wind two ell time ground side river upon brink whereof said causey ought made often broke bargeman mariner force wind torn away earth diminished wasted case causey made would short time consumed wasted away power wind except raised high broad defended mean danger safeguard ease passenger aswell side said river weland within precinct town crouland overthwart causey ought made many high strong bridge would require little chardge end loaded barge boat might passe might serve necessary sewer bridge loaded cart horse others might also travell supporting great chardge ever barge passing way tempestuous time pay xii every loaded cart xij every loaded horse vi penny every man carrying burthen ii every horse loaded iij every man singly going way cattel thing carryed water lesse agreed boatman great storm flouds double exprest paid carriage water way forasmuch making maintenance said causey like chardgable respect length height thicknesse necessary bridge aforesaid said abbot proposed king whether would please grant unto monastery undergo custome space seven year every passenger aswell land water travailing within compasse lordship crouland might suitable work though custome exceed one half passenger time pay seven year expired certain lesser custome apportioned chardge necessary maintainance repair thereof case king would would best endeavour make maintain said causeys bridge vvhich answer said abbot reply made thereto space two year parliament sitting inhabitant kesteven holand exhibited petition ibid king whereby humbly besought safety advantage passenger would take answer beforespecified abbot consideration meet therein vvhereupon said king much regarding safety welfare people therefore desiring better performance work fully certified touching premiss assigned robert de colevill adam de limbergh iohn de ro humphrey de litlebury de bayeux ranulph de parys enquire oath honest lawful men country manner customes much bargeman boatman receive aswell men hope wit man according ability people could invent within xvi year said town expended l upon moreover two indikes reared behind said wall securing town case outer wall fail terrible breach swept away therefore though said indikes already repaired sufficient restrain ordinary tide yet safety country committed consideration whereof certified thought fit new bank raised extraordinary skantling neerer town six hundred acre place better advantage bredth bottom fourscore foot length two mile thicknesse height proportionable forasmuch chardge would insupportable inhabitant said town law sewer could commissioner sewer shewing lynne outragiousnesse tide made much wider formerly put country excessive charge restraining wearing broad deep therefore desired would take view thereof cause straightned according president former time limiting fresh water help increase thereof unto proper outfall like ib f petition prefer lord privy council november following whereupon ensuing order ib f b made honourable board viz special commission directed unto certain gentleman indifferently chosen part together mayor alderman lynne consider conveniencie inconveniencie work also scantling made narrower chardge thereof proceed therein respite executing said commission till according law made august opening river uueland nene work done delay opening river complaint made unto said lord thereof course taken coercion preserving marshland mean time also part adjacent eminent danger viz upon tenth december dec iac iac commissioner sewer sitting peterborough consideration setting sluse certain place called horshoo siding said commissioner jury became divided opinion nothing done therein signified ib f much lord council vvhereupon inhabitant marshland exhibited petition ibid b honourable board imploring care safety country intimatating erection intended sluse would apparent overthrow thereof vvhich petition occasioned said lord write unto beforementioned commissioner letter ib f desired consider outfall sea drew water high country might oppresse marshland low part adjoyning county lincolne norfolk wishing case differ opinion thing might best effected make choice two commissioner county might instructed give true information difference would endeavour give farther direction might best advance publick good least prejudice private whereupon met wisebeche appointed mr henry kervill mr robert balam others take view danger country tirington side fretting chanel ran certifie accordingly view certified chanel fresh water ran much hurt tirington whole country marshland lawfull inhabitant wisebeche stop water running clow farther ordained said bank called hillary diche amended raised higher three foot made eight foot bredth said clow river uuysebeche charge benefit beforementioned sort specified said presentment man according proportion holdeth whensoever need require moreover whereas water old field elme east side river elme ought course issue pipe lying river town said water oldfelde future pas away said pipe called massynghams pipe lying river elme betwixt messuage iohn blythe one patt messuage iohn ratelesdene thence directly antient sewer betwixt land fen thereto belonging hath end thereof certain fishing called edd rmuthe upon east part thereof two mere called wellepole trendelmere betwixt narrow stream containing two furlong length called trendelmere beche two fishing likewise another narrow water one mile long called falet one fishing part thereof betwixt wytlesmere kynkesdelf eastern boundary thereof bredth meer containeth three mile narrow stream called derescuf wood named rageholt south part thereof also another slender stream three furlong length called selfremerebeche two fishing end whereof lake named selfremere south side thereof narrow water half mile long called ubbemere lade head whereof likewise another fishing middle thereof place fen called alwynesbarwe southern boundary thereof moreover west side lake also narrow stream containing two furlong length named trendemere beche hath one fishing end whereof meer called west trendemere side also water viz drelgmere wellepole withibuscemere langemere kinninges thelp drain purse send u good old captain floud lead u battel twopeny jack skakes ons back drive cattel noble captain yet never known fail u conquest get assail u furious rage none could asswage world great wonder bear bank break rank whirlygiggs asunder god eolus thee pray thou wilt wanting thou never saidst u nay listen canting thou deride hope pride purpose confusion send blast haste may work good conclusion great neptune god sea work must need provoke thee mean thee disease fenwater choake thee thy mace thou deface quite confound matter send thy sand make dry land shall want fresh water eke pray thee moon thou wilt propitious see nought done prosper malitious though summer heat hath wrought feat whereby flatter yet good send floud lest essex calf want water upon great complaint therefore doings made lord council find order ib f nov c made bearing date white hall upon november xiiijth year said king reign viz whereas sundry vexatious sutes brought majesty commissioner sewer officer diver obstinate person executing order c said commission great hazard inundation many large levells county northt hunt cambr linc said lord well weighing undue proceeding antient law realm according uantity land common thirdly whether may commit prison disobey order c fourthly whether action false imprisonment trespass proces common law brought commissioner officer executing decree
